intro: Pseudocorchorus pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf corchorus, is a small annual herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes plants such as cotton and hibiscus. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically hairy. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are usually pale green or yellowish. The seeds are encased in a fibrous capsule, which is characteristic of the genus Corchorus.
